segment.source: Migrating UE-V 2.x Settings Packages
segment.target: Migrating UE-V 2.x Settings Packages

segment.source: Migrating UE-V 2.x Settings Packages
segment.target: Migrating UE-V 2.x Settings Packages

segment.source: Migrating UE-V 2.x Settings Packages
segment.target: Migrating UE-V 2.x Settings Packages

segment.source: In the lifecycle of a Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0, 2.1, or 2.1 SP1 deployment, you might have to relocate the user settings packages either when you migrate to a new server or when you perform backups.
segment.target: In the lifecycle of a Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0, 2.1, or 2.1 SP1 deployment, you might have to relocate the user settings packages either when you migrate to a new server or when you perform backups.

segment.source: Settings packages might have to be migrated in the following scenarios:
segment.target: Settings packages might have to be migrated in the following scenarios:

segment.source: Upgrade of existing server hardware to a more modern server.
segment.target: Upgrade of existing server hardware to a more modern server.

segment.source: Migration of a settings storage location share from a test server to a production server.
segment.target: Migration of a settings storage location share from a test server to a production server.

segment.source: Simply copying the files and folders does not preserve the security settings and permissions.
segment.target: Simply copying the files and folders does not preserve the security settings and permissions.

segment.source: The following steps describe how to correctly copy the settings package along with their NTFS file system permissions to a new share.
segment.target: The following steps describe how to correctly copy the settings package along with their NTFS file system permissions to a new share.

segment.source: To preserve UE-V 2 settings packages when you migrate to a new server
segment.target: To preserve UE-V 2 settings packages when you migrate to a new server

segment.source: In a new location on a different server, create a new folder, for example, MySettings.
segment.target: In a new location on a different server, create a new folder, for example, MySettings.

segment.source: Disable sharing for the old folder share on the old server.
segment.target: Disable sharing for the old folder share on the old server.

segment.source: To copy the existing settings packages to the new server with Robocopy
segment.target: To copy the existing settings packages to the new server with Robocopy

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To monitor the copy progress, open MySettings.txt with a log viewer such as Trace32.
segment.target: To monitor the copy progress, open MySettings.txt with a log viewer such as Trace32.

segment.source: Grant share-level permissions to the new share.
segment.target: Grant share-level permissions to the new share.

segment.source: Leave the NTFS file system permissions as they were set by Robocopy.
segment.target: Leave the NTFS file system permissions as they were set by Robocopy.

segment.source: On computers that run the UE-V Agent, update the SettingsStoragePath configuration setting to the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path of the new share.
segment.target: On computers that run the UE-V Agent, update the SettingsStoragePath configuration setting to the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path of the new share.

segment.target: Got a suggestion for UE-V?
